public class zeta.format.impl.FormatStream

(source file: impl/FormatStream.java)
java.lang.Object
   |
   +----zeta.format.impl.FormatStream
The pure class interface. 
public class FormatStream
  extends Object
This class contains a PrintWriter and prints texts, spaces and newlines on that stream. It ignores Spaces at the beginnings and ends of lines. It also provides a means to test, wether the stream is currently at the begin of a line.

It is used by the basic Format classes FormatText, FormatBreak and FormatSpace, as well as the compound Format classes FormatBlock, FormatBeside, FormatAppend, FormatLine and FormatBeneath.

Author:
Jacob Wieland (ughosage@cs.tu-berlin.de)
See also:
Format, FormatText, FormatBreak, FormatSpace, FormatBlock, FormatBeside, FormatAppend, FormatBeneath, FormatLine

FormatStream
public FormatStream(PrintWriter output,
                    boolean wrapAround,
                    int width);

Parameters:
output - the stream on which the format string shall be printed
wrapAround - a flag that enables wrap-around behaviour for lines that are longer than the given width
width - the width that should not be exceeded, if wrapping around should take place

FormatStream

                    int width);

FormatStream

atLineBegin
public boolean atLineBegin();

Returns:
true if the stream is at the begin of a line

printSpaces

public void printSpaces(int width);
This method stores the number of given spaces to be printed, if some text is to be printed afterwards

Parameters:
width - the number of spaces to be printed

printBreaks

public void printBreaks(int lines);
This method first prints the accumulated characters in the current line, wrapping around if necessary (if the line is longer than the width of the stream) and prints the given number of newlines afterwards. This method is used by the FormatBreak class as well as the CompoundFormat and FormatBlock classes. It is also used by the printEndOfFormat method in this class.

Parameters:
lines - The number of newlines to be printed
See also:
printTextBeside, printTextBeside, printTextBeside, printEndOfFormat

printText

public void printText(int indentation,
                      String text);
This method is called for Strings to be printed. It first appends the accumulated spaces (if not at the beginning of a line) or the given indentation (if at beginning of a line) to the current line before it adds the actual text.

Parameters:
indentation - how far shall the text be indented, if at the beginning of a line
text - the string to be printed
See also:
printTextBeside

printEndOfFormat

public void printEndOfFormat();
This method wraps up the printing process. It is called by the outermost Format to be printed after the Format has been printed. If there are still characters in the current line that haven't been printed, yet, they are printed by this method, followed by a newline.

See also:
printFormat
